title: Cinnamon-Streusel Cider Muffins
directions: In a small bowl, stir together the brown sugar, flour and cinnamon. Cut in the butter with a pastry blender. Set aside.

Lightly grease a 12-cup muffin pan or line with paper baking cups; set aside. In a medium mixing bowl, stir together the flour, granulated sugar, baking powder and salt. Make a well in the center. In a small mixing bowl, combine the egg, apple cider and oil; add to the flour mixture. Stir just till moistened. (The batter should be lumpy.)

Spoon about 1 tablespoon of the batter into each prepared muffin cup. Sprinkle 1 teaspoon of the streusel mixture over each. Fill with remaining batter. Sprinkle tops of muffins with remaining streusel. Bake in a preheated 400 degree F oven until golden brown, about 20 minutes. Remove the muffins from pans; cool slightly on racks.
ingredients: 3/4 cup apple cider or apple juice
